title: Exam: Mergers and Acquisitions
description: 15 questions evaluating knowledge of corporate transactions, M&A processes, and Reporting Verbs.

items.question: Which term describes two companies joining to form a completely new entity?
items.explanation: In a merger, two firms agree to move forward as a single new company.

items.question: The advisors ________ (suggest / reduce) the offer price by 5%.
What is 'Due Diligence'?
options: A formal apology for an error
A comprehensive appraisal of a business's health and facts
The process of paying a dividend
items.answer: A comprehensive appraisal of a business's health and facts
items.explanation: Due diligence is critical before finalizing any acquisition.

items.question: The concept that 1 + 1 = 3 in M&A is known as:
items.explanation: Synergy refers to the increased value created by combining companies.

items.question: The board ________ (announce) that the deal was off.
A 'Hostile Takeover' is an acquisition that is:
options: Opposed by the target company's management
items.answer: Opposed by the target company's management
items.explanation: Hostile takeovers are often aggressive and contested.

items.question: Goodwill is an intangible asset representing a company's:
items.explanation: Goodwill is the portion of the purchase price that exceeds the value of net tangible assets.

items.question: The CFO ________ (deny / make) any misleading statements.
An LBO (Leveraged Buyout) uses a high level of ________ to fund an acquisition.
items.explanation: LBOs rely on borrowed funds, using the target's assets as collateral.

items.question: He ________ (urge / the board / consider) the alternative bid.
Which process combines two firms' operations after a deal closes?
items.explanation: Post-merger integration is where the value is actually realized.

items.question: A horizontal merger occurs between companies in:
options: Different stages of the same supply chain

items.question: Analysts ________ (predict / that / the market / grow) next year.
items.answer: predict that the market will grow
items.explanation: Reporting verb + that + clause (with future form).

items.question: Divestiture refers to:
options: Selling a business unit or subsidiary
items.answer: Selling a business unit or subsidiary
items.explanation: Divestiture is the partial or full disposal of a business asset.

items.question: The consultant ________ (recommend / hire) a new integration manager.
